contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "blood" represents a person's death. To be responsible for their own death is spoken of as if their blood would be on their heads. Alternate translation: "their death will be their own fault" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: blood will be upon their own heads

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is the nation of Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the nation of Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the power of Yahweh being strong. Alternate translation: "Yahweh is mighty" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: the hand of Yahweh is mighty

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hearts" refers to their courage. They were so afraid that it was as if their courage melted away like wax in a fire. Alternate translation: "they lost all their courage" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: their hearts melted

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "spirit" refers to their will to fight. Alternate translation: "they no longer had any will to fight" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: there was no longer any spirit in them

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "voice" refers to the things that Yahweh spoke. Alternate translation: "obey the things that Yahweh commanded them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: obey the voice of Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "hand" is a metonym for the control that the hand exercises. Alternate translation: "so that you can control it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: into your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "in obedience to Yahweh" or 2) "in front of Yahweh's ark" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: before Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: Sound leaving someone's mouth refers to that person's speaking or shouting. Alternate translation: "Do not yell or speak" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: No sound must leave your mouths

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "She" refers to Rahab and represents her descendants. Alternate translation: "Her descendants live in Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: She lives in Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: The hands of the Amorites represents their control and power. Giving the Israelites into their hands to destroy them represents allowing the Amorites to have control of the Israelites and destroy them. Alternate translation: "To allow the Amorites to destroy us? (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: To give us into the hands of the Amorites to destroy us?

contextId.occurrenceNote: Doing this represents running away from their enemies. Alternate translation: "Israel has run away from their enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: Israel has turned their backs before their enemies

contextId.occurrenceNote: Making people forget the name of the Israelites represents making them forget the Israelites. In this case they would do it by killing the Israelites. Alternate translation: "They will surround us and kill us, and the people of the earth will forget about us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: They will surround us and make the people of the earth forget our name

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "your great name" here represents God's reputation and power. Alternate translation: "And so what will you do so that people will know that you are great" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: for your great name

contextId.occurrenceNote: Standing before their enemies represents fighting successfully against their enemies. Alternate translation: "cannot fight successfully against their enemies" or "cannot defeat their enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: cannot stand before their enemies

contextId.occurrenceNote: Doing this represents running away from their enemies. Alternate translation: "They ran away from their enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: They turned their backs from their enemies

contextId.occurrenceNote: Being with Israel represents helping Israel. Alternate translation: "I will not help you any more" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: I will not be with you any more

contextId.occurrenceNote: Standing before their enemies represents fighting successfully against them. Alternate translation: "You cannot fight successfully against your enemies" or "You cannot defeat your enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: You cannot stand against your enemies

contextId.occurrenceNote: Giving them into Israel's hand represents giving Israel victory and control over them. Alternate translation: "I have given you victory over the king of Ai and his people, and I have given you control over his city and his land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: I have given into your hand the king of Ai ... and his land

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" symbolizes the control and power the people have over their enemies. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: will give it into your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: "let themselves be defeated before the people of Ai." The phrase "before them" represents what the people of Ai would see and think. The phrase "be defeated" can be stated in active form. Alternate translation:  "let the people of Ai think that the Israelites were defeated" or "let the people of Ai think that they had defeated the Israelites" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let themselves be defeated before them

contextId.occurrenceNote: Giving Ai into Israel's hand represents giving Israel victory and control over Ai. Alternate translation: "I will give you victory over Ai" or "I will cause you to capture Ai" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: I will give Ai into your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the nation of Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "command" represents the one who commanded them. Being under him represents obeying his commands. Alternate translation: "obeying the commands of one leader" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: under one command

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here this refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here this phrase refers to the dwelling place of Yahweh, the Tabernacle. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: house of my God

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "hands" here refers to the people of Israel's strength. Alternate translation: "your strength" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: your hands

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" represents the people of Israel's strength and their ability to defeat their enemy. The word "them" refers to the attacking army. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: I have given them into your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: the nation

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "your hand" here means "your control." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: into your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here their "hand" represents their control. Alternate translation: "Yahweh gave Lachish into the control of the nation of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: into the hand of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: The sword represents the army of Israel and striking expresses the idea of slaughter and destruction. Alternate translation: "They captured and killed and destroyed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: They captured it and struck it with the edge of the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: The sword represents the army of Israel and striking expresses the idea of slaughter and destruction. Alternate translation: "They killed and destroyed them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: They struck them with the edge of the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "house" refers to the descendants. Alternate translation: "the descendants of Joseph" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: the house of Joseph

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "house" represents the descendants of Joseph. The phrase refers to the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh. Alternate translation: "the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the house of Joseph

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand of Moses" refers to the scriptures that Moses wrote down. Alternate translation: "through the things that Moses wrote" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: by the hand of Moses

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the shed blood of a person represents their death. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "avenge a person's death" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: avenge the blood of a person who was killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the shed blood of a person represents their death. This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Joshua 20:3](../20/03.md). Alternate translation: "avenge a person's death" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: avenge the blood of the person who was killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated a similar phrase in [Joshua 20:3](../20/03.md). Alternate translation: "avenge a person's death" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: avenge the blood that was shed

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "by the hand of" here means that Yahweh used Moses as the agent to deliver his command. Alternate translation: "Yahweh had told Moses to command" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh had commanded by the hand of Moses

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "into their hand" means "into their power." Alternate translation: "gave them power to defeat all their enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: gave all their enemies into their hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "my voice" refers to the things that Joshua had said. Alternate translation: "obeyed everything I said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: obeyed my voice

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "the hand of Yahweh" refers to his punishment. Protecting the people is spoken of as rescuing them from his hand. Alternate translation: "you have kept Yahweh from punishing us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: you have rescued the people of Israel out of the hand of Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "stand" represents holding ground in a battle. The word "you" refers to the entire nation of Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-you]])
contextId.glQuote: to stand before you

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" refers to power. Alternate translation: "enabled you to conquer them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: gave them into your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" refers to power. Alternate translation: "enabled you to overcome him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: rescued you out of his hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: This represents his family that lives in his house. Alternate translation: "my family" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: my house

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "listen" means to obey. Alternate translation: "We will obey everything he tells us to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: We will listen to his voice
